metadata.feature_description: Calculate and display user's rank based on reputation points

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify rank display in Activity Tab

steps.expected: Users list is displayed with user activity icons
steps.actual: Users list displayed with 15 users showing profile, settings, roles, and activity icons for each user

steps.action: Click User Activity icon for Test User12
steps.expected: Activity tab expands showing rank information
steps.actual: Activity tab expanded showing: Rank: 3, Reputation: 5, Experience: 5, Engagement: 0, Influence: 0, Recent Activity with 'Joined Site' entry

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify rank calculation based on reputation points

steps.action: Check rank for Test User11 (same reputation as Test User12)
steps.expected: Users with same reputation points should have same rank
steps.actual: Test User11 shows Rank: 3, Reputation: 5, Experience: 5 - same as Test User12, confirming tied scores are handled correctly

steps.action: Check rank for Content Editor user (higher reputation)
steps.expected: User with higher reputation should have better (lower) rank number
steps.actual: Content Editor shows Rank: 2, Reputation: 7, Experience: 11 - better rank than test users with reputation of 5, confirming rank calculation is working correctly

observations: The rank display is only visible when SKU is DNNSOCIAL (Evoq Engage), as confirmed by code review of UserActivityDetails component (line 26: this.showSocial = utilities.getSKU() === 'DNNSOCIAL')
Rank is calculated in the database stored procedure PersonaBar_GetUserActivityDetail by counting users with higher reputation points + 1
Users with zero or no reputation points would show rank as -1 according to the SQL code, but this was not observed during testing as all tested users had reputation points
The Edit Points feature is available to administrators for manually adjusting reputation and experience points
